meanings.definition: A type of seabird in the family Alcidae.
meanings.sent1: The auks nested on the rocky cliffs near the ocean.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of auks diving into the water to catch fish.
meanings.sent3: Why did the auk bring a suitcase to the beach? To have a 'tern' vacation!
meanings.sent4: The auks soared through the sky like tiny feathered arrows.
meanings.sent5: The black and white plumage of the auks made them easy to spot against the blue sea.

meanings.definition: The plural form of the word 'auk'.
meanings.sent1: There were many auks gathered on the shore, creating a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent2: The auks chirped happily as they searched for food along the coastline.
meanings.sent3: The group of auks decided to form a band called 'The Flockers'.
meanings.sent4: The auks stood together in unity, a symbol of strength in numbers.
meanings.sent5: The auks' population grew rapidly, filling the skies with their presence.
